channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk and Bill Gates warn that AI will kill all jobs within 20 years. ‘That’s not what we’re seeing,’ LinkedIn exec says
item.description: Elon Musk may predict a jobless future, but LinkedIn’s latest hiring data shows demand rising, not collapsing. That will be music to Gen Z's ears.

item.title: Netflix’s bombshell deal to buy Warner Bros. brings Batman and Harry Potter to the big red streamer and infuriates theater owners and the Ellisons
item.description: Just days before Netflix emerged as the highest bidder, Paramount tore into the "myopic process" that had become "tainted."

item.title: Dolby Launches Its First Immersive Retail Destination Experience
item.description: New store set up gives customers real hands-on contact with Dolby’s home entertainment technologies – with special deals and prizes on offer over its ...

item.title: Can Cities Keep Up With An Aging World? Emerging Models Show Promise
item.description: With imagination, thoughtful design, and inclusive planning, cities can become places where everyone—at 8, 80, and every age in between—can thrive.

item.title: Five Netflix Shows Like ‘Stranger Things’ To Watch While Waiting For Volume 2
item.description: Stranger Things Volume 2 is not out for a while, so here are five other sci-fi shows on Netflix to tide you over until it returns.

item.title: Fed's favored inflation gauge shows consumer prices remained elevated in September
item.description: The Commerce Department's delayed September PCE inflation report showed that inflation remained well above the Federal Reserve's 2% target ahead of a ...

item.title: Microsoft Confirms New Upgrade Decision For All Windows Users
item.description: How to get Microsoft’s new upgrade on your PC — it’s the simplest Windows upgrade ever.

item.title: Here Are The WB Games Netflix Now Owns After Its Warner Bros. Purchase
item.description: After Netflix's huge purchase of WB, that includes WB Games and all the projects it's currently working on, or may make in the future.

item.title: Apple is experiencing its biggest leadership shakeup since Steve Jobs died
item.description: The exodus of top talent spans critical divisions from AI to design, legal affairs, environmental policy, and operations.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott is trying to close the DEI gap in higher ed, with $155 million in donations this week alone
item.description: These gifts are a “major source of encouragement” during uncertain times for higher education.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos credits a video store job for launching his career—and cherishes this lesson from Tony Bennett
item.description: "It was an MBA course and film school all wrapped up into one for me," he said.

item.title: Grand Canyon South Rim hotels forced to close due to water pipe breaks
item.description: Grand Canyon South Rim faces water emergency as broken pipeline forces hotel closures. Park remains open for day visits while water repairs continue.

item.title: US layoffs soar past 1.1M in 2025, highest level since the pandemic

item.title: Small businesses lead November job losses as tariff uncertainty weighs on hiring
item.description: Small businesses lost 120,000 jobs in November amid heightened economic uncertainty over tariffs and outpaced job gains at larger firms, according to ...

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
